description: You may have noticed the /b/Hone/b/ meter on tools you've made.
The hone progress increments every time the /6/tool uses durability/6/. Upon filling, the tool will /c/stop gaining progress/c/ and be ready for honing.

Hone improvements give /b/flat bonuses/b/ in exchange for /c/tool intergrity/c/. A well-honed tool will simply be more effective then one without. Some /6/other improvments/6/, such as a sword's /b/Searated/b/ blade, may also be /6/honed/6/.

Honing can be very valuable, but it should be noted that the /6/more intergrity/6/ a tool has, the /6/longer it may take to hone/6/. Socketing a /b/Lapis Lazuli/b/ gem into the side of the tool allows honing progress to be obtained by /6/earning experince/6/ as well.
